intro: Camissonia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf camissonia, is a delicate annual herb native to the western United States. It typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are white or pale blue, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Camissonia tenuifolia is part of the Camissoniaceae family and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and arid conditions.
